clinical_study.brief_title: Systematic Screening With Electrocardiogram for Unknown Atrial Fibrillation in 65 Years Old and Above People in Nursing Home
clinical_study.official_title: Systematic Screening With Electrocardiogram for Unknown Atrial Fibrillation in 65 Years Old and Above People in Nursing Home

brief_summary.textblock: Atrial fibrillation is the most common arrhythmia. Some studies shown that systematic screening with electrocardiogram could improve atrial fibrillation detection. No studies are available in nursing home. The goal of this study is to screen atrial fibrillation in patients who live in nursing home.

detailed_description.textblock:
A prospective observational cross sectional multicenter study.
The goal of this study is to detect atrial fibrillation in nursing home people aged 65 years old and above, with systematic electrocardiogram. Participants agreement will be collected. Participants characteristics data will be collected in all nursing home. For all participants, one visit were realised with electrocardiogram, and symptoms survey. Data were anonymised on each center before analysed.

clinical_study.why_stopped: The Study halted prematurely because the potential for recruitment into the associated center was reached.

primary_outcome.measure: presence of atrial fibrillation on electrocardiogram
primary_outcome.description: detection of atrial fibrillation during the electrocardiogram

arm_group.description: Patient will take an electrocardiogram in order to detect atrial fibrillation

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion criteria :
- Being in nursing home since 1 month and above
- Aged > 65 years old
- Subjects agree to participate at this project
Exclusion criteria :
- Antecedent of atrial fibrillation
